bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Writ of Certiorari
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: IN THExUNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Petition of James P. Lavin, Immigtant Inspector and Sister M. Angelique, Sis- Superior of the House of the Good Shepherd, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.} No.1078 Writ of Cetiorari
The United States of America, To the Superior Court of the State of Washington for the County of King, Greting;-

You are hereby commanded and directed, in that certain cause now pending before the Judges of said Court, entitled "In the Matter of the Application of Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre and Georgette Normand", number 38028, to stay all further proceedings in said cause and to send to this Court the record and proceedings therein forthwith.
Witness the Hon. Melville W. Fuller, Chief Justice of the United States, this 14th day of Febuary, 1903
CH Hanford District Judge, presiding in the Circuit Court of the United States dor the District of Washington.
A Reeves Avres Clerk for the Circuit Court for the District of Washington.
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON. FEB 14 1903 A.REVES AYRES, Clerk HM Statiherd
In Circuit Court of U.S. District Washington
In the wall of application of law O I am & awp;; for writ of Cetiorar
Affidavit FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON MAR 5 1903 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Statiherd
